Top-3 Similar Questions: au_383339: How to recover deleted "dpkg" directory?
au_282497: Deleted the kernel and unable to recover it
Top-3 Scripts:
au_383339: sudo mkdir -p /var/lib/dpkg/{alternatives,info,parts,triggers,updates}

sudo cp /var/backups/dpkg.status.0 /var/lib/dpkg/status

apt-get download dpkg
sudo dpkg -i dpkg*.deb

apt-get download base-files
sudo dpkg -i base-files*.deb

dpkg --audit
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get check

ul_364229: sudo hexdump -C /dev/<the disk>  | grep LUKS

sudo losetup -o <offset> -r -f /dev/nvme0n1

sudo cryptsetup luksOpen /dev/loop1 luksrecover

cd /home/<yourusername>

 sudo ecryptfs-recover-private .Private/

au_282497: sudo apt-get --reinstall install grub2
sudo update-grub
